content.description: To investigate whether there is a difference in opinion on a certain proposal between two voting districts, A and B, two independent random samples were taken. From district A, 35 of the 50 voters selected were in favor of the proposal, and from district B, 36 of the 60 voters selected were in favor of the proposal.
content.question: Which of the following is the test statistic for the appropriate test to investigate whether there is a difference in the proportion of voters who are in favor of the proposal between the two districts (district A minus district B)?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 35 minus 36 over the square root of the fraction 35 over 50 plus the fraction 36 over 60, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>35</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>36</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 35 minus 36 over the square root of the fraction 0.7 over 50 plus the fraction 0.6 over 60, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>35</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>36</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.7 minus 0.6 over the square root of 0.65 times 0.35, times open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 50 plus the fraction 1 over 60, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.65</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.35</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.7 minus 0.6 over the square root of 0.7 times 0.6, times the fraction 1 over 50 plus 60, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.7 minus 0.6, over 0.7 times 0.6 times the square root of the fraction 1 over 50 plus the fraction 1 over 60, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>)</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 0.7 minus 0.6 over the square root of 0.65 times 0.35, times open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 50 plus the fraction 1 over 60, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.7</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.65</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.35</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
